usecase_1: 在“智慧医疗数据空间”中，区域医疗中心作为数据提供者，发布了一个包含临床试验结果和患者统计（匿名聚合）的数据集（ClinicalTrialStats）。该数据集默认遵循联盟的基础数据共享政策，允许联盟内的生物医药研究机构成员仅限非盈利性科研使用，但须在相关论文中注明数据来源。同时，区域医疗中心为特定的医疗AI开发企业制定了附加政策，允许其在AI诊断模型训练平台上商业性使用ClinicalTrialStats，条件是每半年向区域医疗中心提交详细使用报告并支付数据授权费用。此外，联盟政策严禁任何成员或第三方尝试还原匿名患者身份信息。
usecase_2: 在“能源物联网数据空间”中，国家电力调度中心作为数据提供者，发布了一个包含分布式电网实时负荷和用电模式（匿名聚合）的数据集（GridLoadData）。该数据集默认遵循联盟的基础数据共享政策，允许联盟内的高校能源研究团队仅用于学术研究目的，且须在研究报告中注明数据来源。同时，国家电力调度中心为特定的智能电网解决方案供应商制定了附加政策，允许其在能源管理平台商业性使用GridLoadData，前提是每季度提交数据使用报告并缴纳许可费用。此外，联盟政策明令禁止任何成员或第三方试图识别出单一用户的用电行为。
usecase_3: 在“工业制造数据空间”中，智能工厂联盟作为数据提供者，发布了一个包含生产设备运行状态和产能统计（匿名聚合）的数据集（FactoryOpsData）。该数据集默认遵循联盟的基础数据共享政策，允许联盟内的工业工程院校成员仅限于教学与科研用途，并须在成果发布时注明数据来源。同时，智能工厂联盟为特定的工业自动化软件开发商制定了附加政策，允许其在生产优化平台商业性使用FactoryOpsData，条件是每季度向联盟提交详细使用报告并支付数据许可费。此外，联盟政策严格禁止任何成员或第三方尝试还原设备或工厂的具体身份信息。
usecase_4: 在“农业食品数据空间”中，省级农产品流通协会作为数据提供者，发布了一个包含农产品流通路径和批量销售数据（匿名聚合）的数据集（AgriFlowData）。该数据集默认遵循联盟的基础数据共享政策，允许联盟内的食品安全研究机构仅限非商业性分析使用，且须在研究成果中注明数据来源。同时，省级农产品流通协会为特定的供应链管理平台运营商制定了附加政策，允许其在供应链优化系统中商业性使用AgriFlowData，前提是每季度提交使用报告并按合同支付数据许可费用。此外，联盟政策严禁任何成员或第三方试图还原单一农户或批次的身份信息。
usecase_5: 在“绿色建筑数据空间”中，城市绿色发展委员会作为数据提供者，发布了一个包含建筑能耗和碳排放（匿名聚合）的数据集（GreenBuildingData）。该数据集默认遵循联盟的基础数据共享政策，允许联盟内的环境科学研究机构成员仅限于可持续发展研究使用，并须在成果中注明数据来源。同时，城市绿色发展委员会为特定的建筑节能解决方案供应商制定了附加政策，允许其在节能评估平台商业性使用GreenBuildingData，条件是每季度向委员会提交详细使用报告并支付数据许可费。此外，联盟政策严格禁止任何成员或第三方尝试还原单栋建筑的具体能耗信息。
usecase_6: 工业互联网数据空间管理方须建立统一的企业资质审核机制，流程包括申请受理、技术能力核查及合规信用评估。申请企业需通过专属门户提交资质材料和应用场景说明，管理方应于3个工作日内完成材料初步审核。技术核查阶段应使用自动化工具评估企业技术方案、网络安全能力及API接口合规性，重点检查是否达到工业信息安全三级标准及数据加密、访问权限等关键要求。信用评估需接入国家企业信用信息公示系统，核查企业经营异常、法律诉讼及行业信用分级，涉外企业还需提供数据跨境合规备案证明。审核通过名单需公示2个工作日无异议后方可接入，整个流程各环节应通过区块链留痕，确保审核全程可追溯且不可篡改。
usecase_7: 医疗健康数据联盟运营机构应制定统一的成员资质审核规范，审核流程涵盖申请受理、系统安全评估及信用资质核查。申请机构需通过联盟平台提交资质文件及具体数据使用场景描述，运营机构需在7个自然日内完成材料合规性初审。系统安全评估阶段需借助自动化检测平台对机构的技术方案、数据安全措施及接口标准合规性进行检查，重点核实是否满足《电子健康信息安全等级保护》二级及以上标准，特别关注数据脱敏与访问控制能力。信用核查应对接医疗行业信用数据库，核查机构历史违规记录、行政处罚及信用等级，境外机构需补充数据出境合规证明。审核通过名单公示5个自然日无异议后正式纳入联盟，审核全流程应通过区块链技术实现过程存证，确保可追溯性和不可篡改性。
usecase_8: 能源数据协作空间平台方应建立标准化的参与方资质审核流程，包括申请受理、技术合规性验证和信用风险评估。申请方需通过能源协作门户提交资质证明及业务应用说明，平台方应在2个工作日内完成材料完整性初查。技术合规性验证阶段应依托自动化检测系统，对申请方的技术架构、数据安全能力和接口标准进行评估，重点核查是否符合能源行业安全三级认证及数据加密、访问控制等核心要求。信用风险评估应接入能源行业信用平台，核查历史经营异常、司法纠纷及信用评级，涉外申请方需额外提交数据跨境合规备案。通过名单公示1个工作日无异议后准予接入，所有审核环节均应通过区块链技术留存证据，确保审核过程可溯源、不可篡改。
usecase_9: 智慧城市数据空间管理机构须制定统一的数据主体准入审核流程，流程包括申请受理、技术能力评估及信用资质核验。申请主体需通过城市数据空间门户提交资质材料与应用场景说明，管理机构应在4个工作日内完成材料初审。技术能力评估阶段应借助自动化检测工具对主体的技术方案、信息安全措施及接口合规性进行评估，重点检查是否符合城市信息安全三级标准及数据加密、访问权限等要求。信用资质核验应对接城市公共信用信息平台，核查主体历史经营异常、司法涉诉及行业信用等级，跨境主体需补充数据出境合规备案材料。审核通过名单需公示2个工作日无异议后方可正式接入，全流程各环节应通过区块链技术存证，保障审核过程的可追溯性和不可篡改性。
usecase_10: 农业数据共享空间运营方应建立统一的成员资质审核机制，审核流程包括申请受理、技术合规性检测及信用评估。申请成员需通过农业数据平台提交资质证明及业务应用说明，运营方应在6个工作日内完成材料完整性初审。技术合规性检测阶段需依托自动化检测工具对成员的技术方案、数据安全能力及接口标准合规性开展评估，重点核查是否达到农业数据安全三级标准及数据加密、访问控制等核心指标。信用评估环节应接入农业行业信用信息系统，核查成员历史经营异常、司法诉讼及信用评级，涉外成员需额外提供数据跨境合规备案文件。通过名单需公示3个工作日无异议后正式准入，审核全流程各环节应通过区块链技术留存证据，确保审核过程可追溯且不可篡改。
usecase_11: 在“智慧医疗数据空间”中，要求“医院联盟”在接入“临床试验结果”时，必须建立包括分类分级、质量评估和合规筛查在内的三重管控体系。分类依据《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》，将数据分为普通、重要和核心三类，并从数据敏感性（如患者隐私、公共健康、行业数据）、应用场景（如科研、医疗服务、政策制定）、风险等级（1-4级）三个维度进行标注。对于3级及以上的数据，需额外进行数据溯源和使用范围条款的审查。质量标准包括数据完整性（≥98%）、字段填充率（≥95%）、时效性（实时数据延迟≤1秒），接入时数据提供方须通过质量检测工具生成评估报告。数据接入审核还必须验证数据采集的合法性和授权的完整性。
usecase_12: 在“能源数据共享联盟”中，“电网运营商”接入“分布式能源消纳数据”时，必须实施分类分级、质量评估与合规筛查三位一体的管理体系。分类遵循《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》，类别包括常规、关键和核心数据，需从数据敏感性（如个人用电信息、企业能耗、行业统计）、应用场景（如能效分析、市场交易、政策监管）、风险等级（1-4级）三方面进行标注。3级及以上数据需进行数据血缘追溯和用途限制条款的附加审查。质量标准要求数据完整性不低于98%、字段填充率不低于95%、实时数据延迟不超过1秒，数据提供方须提交由质量检测工具生成的评估报告。审核过程中还需重点核查数据采集的合规性与授权情况。
usecase_13: 在“智慧农业数据空间”中，“农技服务平台”申请接入“遥感作物生长数据”时，必须建立涵盖分类分级、质量评估和合规筛查的综合管控体系。分类依据《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》，分为基础、重要和核心数据，并从数据敏感性（如地块隐私、产量数据、行业信息）、应用场景（如精准种植、农业科研、政策补贴）、风险等级（1-4级）三维度进行标注。3级及以上数据需额外进行数据来源溯源和使用限制条款的审查。质量要求包括数据完整性≥98%、字段填充率≥95%、实时性（延迟≤1秒），接入时需由数据提供方提交质量检测工具生成的评估报告。审核还需验证数据采集的合法性及授权的完整性。
usecase_14: 在“金融数据互联平台”中，“商业银行”接入“企业信用评级数据”时，必须执行分类分级、质量评估和合规筛查三重管理机制。分类遵循《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》，数据分为普通、重要、核心三类，并从敏感性（如企业隐私、公共信用、行业数据）、应用场景（如信贷审批、风险控制、监管合规）、风险等级（1-4级）三方面进行标注。3级及以上数据需进行数据血缘追溯和用途限制条款的附加审查。质量标准包括数据完整性≥98%、字段填充率≥95%、实时数据延迟≤1秒，数据提供方需通过质量检测工具生成并提交评估报告。数据接入审核还应重点核查数据采集的合法性和授权的完整性。
usecase_15: 在“智慧城市数据空间”中，“城市管理局”在接入“实时交通流量数据”时，必须建立集分类分级、质量评估和合规筛查于一体的管控体系。分类依据《GB/T 43697-2024数据安全技术 数据分类分级规则》，分为一般、重要、核心三类，并从数据敏感性（如车牌信息、公共出行、行业数据）、应用场景（如交通调度、城市规划、应急管理）、风险等级（1-4级）三维度进行标注。对于3级及以上数据，需额外进行数据血缘追溯和用途限制条款的审查。质量标准为数据完整性≥98%、字段填充率≥95%、实时性（延迟≤1秒），数据提供方需提交由质量检测工具生成的评估报告。数据接入审核还需重点验证数据采集的合法性及授权的完整性。
usecase_16: 在“工业互联网数据空间”中，若数据归属不明或合规性存在争议，相关方可提交仲裁。合作协议须指定专属仲裁机构，仲裁流程包括：争议双方需于2个工作日内提交完整的数据授权与处理凭证；仲裁裁决将由区块链智能合约自动执行，如数据被判违规则立即执行链上数据销毁；若争议数据涉及关键基础设施安全，须第一时间上报国家级监管部门并冻结所有相关数据访问权限。
usecase_17: 在“医疗健康数据联盟”内，针对所有权不明或合规风险的数据，允许通过第三方仲裁解决。联盟协议需明示仲裁机构，仲裁时各方需在5个工作日内提交包括采集同意书和处理日志在内的全部证据；仲裁决定通过智能合约自动落实，若认定数据违规则立即执行数据不可逆删除；如争议数据涉及公共卫生安全，需立刻报告至省级卫健委并暂停相关数据流转。
usecase_18: 在“能源数据互联平台”中，若数据权属或合规性存在疑问，平台成员可申请仲裁。数据共享协议应明确仲裁机构及流程，争议各方需于1个工作日内提交完整的采集授权及处理记录；仲裁结果由智能合约自动执行，若数据被判违规则触发链上数据销毁流程；涉及国家能源安全的数据争议，须立即上报至国家能源局并临时冻结数据账户。
usecase_19: 在“智慧城市数据协作区”内，针对归属不明或合规性存疑的数据，允许通过指定仲裁机构裁决。运营协议需规定仲裁流程，争议方须在48小时内提交包括数据采集授权、处理过程证明在内的证据链；仲裁结果将由智能合约自动执行，如认定数据违规则立即执行区块链数据销毁指令；若争议数据涉及城市公共安全，需即时上报市级网信办并冻结相关数据访问。
usecase_20: 在“金融数据共享联盟”中，若数据归属或合规性产生争议，联盟成员可请求仲裁。联盟协议应明确仲裁机构，争议双方需在2个工作日内提交完整的采集授权和处理记录等证据；仲裁结果通过智能合约自动执行，若判定数据违规则立即执行链上销毁操作；如争议数据涉及金融安全，须立即上报中央金融监管部门并暂停相关账户操作。
usecase_21: 在“医疗数据互联平台”中，医院联盟需通过标准化API实现电子病历数据的发布、检索与交付全流程。接口要求：数据目录检索接口应支持跨医院联合查询，返回结果需标明数据可用性状态（如“即时获取”或“需伦理审批”）；数据交付接口需兼容HL7 FHIR等主流协议，支持分段加密与动态寻址，确保高敏感健康数据以“可用不可见”方式交付。流程规定：发布阶段，数据提供方须通过加密通道上传数据并生成带有哈希和数字签名的完整性凭证；检索阶段，用户可查询资源，结果自动标注可用性并过滤未授权内容；交付阶段，数据需加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据必须通过隐私计算平台实现价值释放，严禁明文传输。
usecase_22: 在“能源数据协作空间”中，电网运营商必须采用统一接口标准完成能耗数据的发布、查询与交付。接口规范：目录查询接口应支持多区域联合检索，返回结果需指明数据可用性（如“直接访问”或“需审批”）；交付接口应兼容MQTT、HTTPS等协议，支持分片加密和动态路由，确保高敏感能耗数据以“可用不可见”模式交付。流程要求：发布时，数据方需通过安全通道上传数据并同步生成哈希和数字签名；查询时，用户可检索数据，结果自动标注可用性并屏蔽未授权内容；交付时，数据必须加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据须通过可信执行环境处理，禁止明文传递。
usecase_23: 在“金融风控数据空间”中，银行联盟被要求通过标准化接口实现信贷数据的全流程共享。接口要求：数据目录查询接口需支持跨行联合检索，返回结果应包含数据可用性状态（如“可直接调用”或“需合规审批”）；数据交付接口应兼容SFTP、HTTPS等主流协议，支持分片加密与动态寻址，确保高敏感信贷数据采用“可用不可见”模式交付。数据交互流程包括：发布阶段，数据提供方需通过加密通道上传数据并生成哈希及数字签名；查询阶段，用户可检索数据，结果自动标注可用性并过滤未授权内容；交付阶段，数据交付需采用加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据必须通过隐私计算框架处理，禁止明文传输。
usecase_24: 在“智慧农业数据空间”中，农企联盟应通过标准化接口实现作物生长数据的发布、检索与交付。接口规范：目录查询接口需支持跨区域联合检索，返回结果应标明数据可用性（如“可直接获取”或“需授权”）；交付接口应兼容主流物联网协议，支持分片加密和动态寻址，确保高敏感农业数据以“可用不可见”方式交付。流程规定：发布阶段，数据方需通过加密通道上传数据并生成哈希和数字签名；检索阶段，用户可检索数据，结果自动标注可用性并过滤未授权内容；交付阶段，数据交付需加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据须通过可信执行环境或隐私计算平台处理，严禁明文传输。
usecase_25: 在“智慧城市数据空间”中，城市管理局需通过标准化接口实现城市传感器数据的发布、查询与交付。接口要求：数据目录查询接口应支持多部门联合检索，返回结果应包含数据可用性状态（如“可直接调用”或“需部门审批”）；数据交付接口应兼容RESTful、WebSocket等协议，支持分片加密与动态路由寻址，确保高敏感城市数据采用“可用不可见”模式交付。数据交互流程包括：发布阶段，数据方需通过加密通道上传数据并生成哈希值和数字签名；查询阶段，用户可检索空间内资源，结果自动标注可用性并过滤未授权内容；交付阶段，数据交付需采用加密传输，3级及以上敏感数据必须通过可信执行环境或隐私计算框架实现价值释放，禁止明文传输。
usecase_26: 在“智慧医疗数据联盟”中，要求所有“医疗数据服务商”每12个月接受一次数据安全能力复核，若复核未达标，给予90天整改期，逾期仍不合格者将被移除服务商名单，并对“健康数据产品供应商”实施持续合规检查；对于已接入的“临床试验数据”，每6个月进行一次质量抽检，若不合格率超过5%，则需重新提交全部数据进行全面复审；当相关医疗数据法规或国家标准发生变更时，应于30个工作日内修订审核标准并通知所有成员，确保其在整改期限内或新规生效前完成合规更新。
usecase_27: 在“智慧能源数据空间”中，所有“电力设备运维企业”须每12个月接受一次数据安全能力复查，未达标者有90天整改期，整改无效者将被从合格供应商列表中剔除，同时对“能源数据服务提供方”实施动态合规监控；所有已接入的“变电站运行数据”需每6个月进行质量抽检，若抽检不合格率高于5%，则需重新提交全量数据进行审核；如遇能源数据相关法律或国家标准修订，应在30个工作日内更新审核流程并通知全部参与方，确保其在整改期或新规生效前完成合规调整。
usecase_28: 在“智慧农业数据协作平台”中，所有“农机数据集成商”必须每12个月进行一次数据安全能力复评，未通过者有90天整改期，逾期未合格将被移出平台服务商名单，并对“农产品追溯服务商”实施实时合规检查；所有已接入的“农田遥感影像数据”需每6个月进行质量抽检，若不合格率超过5%，则需重新提交全部数据进行全面审核；当农业数据相关法律法规或国家标准更新或出台时，应于30个工作日内修订审核政策并通知所有合作方，督促其在整改期或新规生效前完成合规整改。
usecase_29: 在“智慧物流数据空间”中，所有“第三方物流数据服务商”需每12个月接受一次数据安全能力复审，若未达标，给予90天整改期，逾期仍未合格者将被移除服务商目录，并对“物流信息产品供应商”实施动态合规审查；所有已接入的“运输轨迹数据”每6个月进行一次质量抽检，若抽检不合格率高于5%，则需重新提交全部数据进行全面复核；当物流数据相关法律法规或行业标准发生调整时，应于30个工作日内更新审核规则并通知所有成员，确保其在整改期限或新规生效前完成合规调整。
usecase_30: 在“智慧金融数据联盟”中，所有“金融科技服务商”必须每12个月接受一次数据安全能力复核，未通过者有90天整改期，逾期未合格将被移出服务商名单，并对“金融数据产品供应商”实施动态合规检查；所有已接入的“信贷风险评估数据”需每6个月进行质量抽检，若不合格率超过5%，则需重新提交全部数据进行全面审查；当金融数据相关法律法规或国家标准修订或新发布时，应在30个工作日内更新审核流程并通知所有参与方，确保其在整改期或新规生效前完成合规调整。
usecase_31: 在“智慧医疗数据空间”中，要求通过“访问日志存证-零知识证明-异常熔断”机制确保患者数据全生命周期可追溯。日志管理需覆盖数据查询、分析、传输及销毁各环节，涉及敏感字段访问或跨境传输时，必须附加零知识证明并将哈希锚定至联盟链，原始日志保存期不得少于7年。个人健康信息处理应采用同态加密与联邦学习，确保数据可用不可见；统计数据共享需满足差分隐私（ε≤1.2）标准。数据服务商需负责技术合规性验证并向医疗联盟提交第三方检测报告。若单日异常访问量超出日均120%，自动分三级熔断：一级暂停账户，二级隔离数据，三级启动全网安全检查。解除熔断需医疗联盟完成原因分析并由服务方重新通过安全认证。
usecase_32: 在“能源物联网数据联盟”中，要求通过“操作日志存证-零知识验证-异常熔断”机制保障电力设备数据全流程可追溯。日志需涵盖数据采集、处理、传输及销毁，关键操作如高敏感参数访问或数据跨境流动，必须附带零知识证明并经哈希上链，原始日志保存期至少6年。个人用能信息处理应采用同态加密及联邦学习，统计数据共享需满足差分隐私（ε≤1.0）标准。数据服务方负责合规性验证并向联盟运营方提交第三方合规报告。若单日异常访问量超出日均130%，自动分三级熔断响应：一级暂停账户，二级隔离资源，三级启动全联盟安全巡检。解除熔断需运营方完成分析报告且服务方重新通过安全认证。
usecase_33: 在“智慧城市交通数据空间”中，规定必须通过“全链路日志存证-零知识证明-异常熔断”保障交通流量数据全生命周期可追溯。日志应覆盖数据调用、分析、传输及销毁，涉及敏感路段数据访问或数据出境时，需附加零知识证明并将哈希锚定至城市区块链，原始日志保存期不得少于8年。个人出行轨迹处理需采用同态加密与联邦学习，统计数据共享须满足差分隐私（ε≤1.3）要求。数据服务商需负责合规性验证并向城市管理方提交第三方检测报告。若单日异常访问量超过日均140%，自动触发三级熔断：一级暂停账户，二级隔离数据，三级启动全域安全巡检。解除熔断需管理方完成原因分析且服务方重新通过安全认证。
usecase_34: 在“工业互联网数据空间”中，要求通过“操作日志存证-零知识验证-异常熔断”机制实现设备运行数据全生命周期可追溯。日志需覆盖数据采集、处理、传输、销毁各环节，关键操作如敏感参数访问或数据跨境传输，必须附加零知识证明并将哈希锚定至联盟链，原始日志保存期不得少于5年。个人工厂数据处理应采用同态加密、联邦学习，统计数据共享需满足差分隐私（ε≤1.4）要求。数据服务方负责合规性验证并向工业联盟提交第三方检测报告。若单日异常访问量超过日均150%，自动分三级熔断响应：一级暂停账户，二级隔离数据，三级启动全网安全巡检。解除熔断需联盟方完成分析报告且服务方重新通过安全认证。
usecase_35: 在“金融数据协作空间”中，规定必须通过“全流程日志存证-零知识验证-异常熔断”机制保障信贷数据全生命周期可追溯。日志管理应覆盖数据查询、分析、传输及销毁，涉及敏感字段访问或跨境传输时，需附加零知识证明并将哈希锚定至金融区块链，原始日志保存期不得少于10年。个人金融信息处理应采用同态加密、联邦学习，统计数据共享需满足差分隐私（ε≤1.1）标准。数据服务商需负责合规性验证并向金融监管方提交第三方检测报告。若单日异常访问量超过日均125%，自动触发三级熔断：一级暂停账户，二级隔离数据，三级启动全域安全巡检。解除熔断需监管方完成分析报告且服务方重新通过安全认证。
usecase_36: In the 'Healthcare Research Data Space', only individuals aged 16 or older, or the minimum age of consent in their jurisdiction, are permitted to register and access 'Clinical Trial Results'. Users under 18 must obtain consent from a parent or legal guardian. Registration requires submission of accurate, complete information. Account credentials must not be shared or transferred, and users are responsible for all activities under their account. If registering or accessing data on behalf of an organization, the user must have proper authorization to accept these terms for that entity.
usecase_37: Within the 'Smart Energy Consortium', participants must be at least 15 years old, or meet the minimum legal age in their region, to access 'Grid Usage Analytics' services. Those below 18 require parental or guardian approval. Accurate and truthful information is mandatory for account creation. Sharing of account credentials or granting access to others is prohibited, and account holders are accountable for all actions performed under their credentials. When acting for another party or company, the registrant must be duly authorized to agree to these terms on their behalf.
usecase_38: In the 'AgriData Exchange Platform', only users who are at least 14 years old, or the minimum age of consent as per local regulations, may register and access 'Crop Yield Forecast Data'. Users under 18 must secure permission from a parent or legal guardian. Registration demands complete and correct information. Account details must remain confidential and not be disclosed or shared; users bear responsibility for all activities linked to their account. If an account is created or used for another individual or entity, the user must possess the authority to accept these conditions for them.
usecase_39: The 'Urban Infrastructure Data Space' requires that members be at least 17 years old, or satisfy the minimum age for consent in their country, to register and access 'Public Transit Utilization Data'. Parental or legal guardian consent is mandatory for users under 18. Registration must be completed with accurate and comprehensive details. Account credentials are strictly personal and must not be shared or made accessible to others; the account holder is liable for all account activity. When registering or using the service for another person or organization, appropriate authorization to accept these terms is required.
usecase_40: On the 'Gaia-X Trusted Zone', access to 'Distributed Manufacturing Schedules' is permitted only to users aged 18 or above, or the minimum age required by applicable law. Users younger than 18 must have explicit parental or guardian consent. Registration necessitates the provision of truthful and complete information. Sharing account credentials or allowing others to use the account is forbidden, and users are responsible for all actions taken with their account. If acting on behalf of another party or entity, the user must be empowered to agree to these terms for them.
usecase_41: If you believe your proprietary manufacturing data has been misused within the 'Gaia-X Trusted Zone', please submit a formal complaint to the designated compliance office or complete the online incident report. We may restrict or remove datasets that are found or alleged to breach these Data Space Terms, and will suspend access for repeat violators as necessary. Written complaints must include: an authorized representative's signature, a description of the proprietary data in question, the location of the suspected misuse within the platform, your contact details, a statement of good-faith belief that the use is unauthorized, and a declaration of accuracy under penalty of perjury.
usecase_42: Should you suspect that your trade secrets have been improperly accessed in the 'Healthcare Research Data Space', you must notify the Data Steward at the provided contact address or via the official reporting portal. The Data Space Operator may disable or remove data assets believed to infringe these rules or upon credible allegations, and will revoke credentials of persistent offenders where justified. Reports must contain: a signed statement from an authorized agent, details of the confidential material, a pointer to the data's location, your full contact information, a good-faith assertion of unauthorized use, and a sworn declaration of truthfulness and authority.
usecase_43: If you identify unauthorized use of your geospatial imagery within the 'Urban Planning Data Exchange', please alert the Data Governance Team at the listed address or through the digital complaint form. Content suspected or alleged to violate these Participation Conditions may be blocked or deleted, and repeat breaches will result in user account termination as appropriate. Submissions must include: a physical or digital signature of your authorized representative, identification of the protected imagery, a reference to where the content appears, your contact information, a statement of good-faith belief of infringement, and a declaration of accuracy and authority under penalty of perjury.
usecase_44: In the event that your proprietary sensor data is believed to be infringed upon in the 'Industrial IoT Data Space', you are required to submit a notice to the Compliance Desk or use the online infringement notification tool. The Data Space Administrator may remove or restrict access to content suspected or alleged to violate these Participation Policies, and will deactivate accounts of repeat offenders when warranted. Notices must include: an authorized signature, a description of the data asset, the location of the alleged infringement, your address, phone, and email, a good-faith statement regarding unauthorized use, and a certification of accuracy and authority under penalty of perjury.
usecase_45: If you suspect your clinical trial results have been improperly shared within the 'Pharmaceutical R&D Data Consortium', you should send a detailed notice to the consortium's legal contact or complete the secure reporting form. The consortium may suspend or remove datasets believed or alleged to violate these Terms, and will terminate access for habitual violators as necessary. Written notifications must provide: a signature from an authorized person, a description of the affected clinical data, a reference to its location in the repository, your contact details, a good-faith statement regarding the unauthorized use, and a declaration of accuracy and authority under penalty of perjury.
usecase_46: To participate in the 'Healthcare Research Data Space', you must register an account. During registration, you are required to provide accurate, current, and complete information and update it as necessary. You are obligated to safeguard your login credentials and shall not share them with any external party. If you detect any unauthorized activity on your account, you must promptly notify the Data Space Operator at: https://www.healthdata.org/report. You acknowledge full responsibility for all actions performed under your account. The Operator reserves the right to suspend your account at any time for non-compliance with these policies, detection of misuse, or violation of applicable regulations. If you wish to terminate your account, contact the Operator at the same link. Upon deletion, your account and all related data will be irreversibly removed.
usecase_47: Access to the 'Smart Energy Grid Data Exchange' requires creating a user profile. When registering, you shall provide truthful and updated details, maintaining their accuracy at all times. You are responsible for keeping your password confidential and must not share it with others. Should you suspect any unauthorized access, immediately inform the platform administrator at: https://www.energygrid.com/support. You accept sole liability for all activities conducted through your account. The platform may revoke your access if you breach these terms, if illicit or harmful actions are detected, or if legal requirements are not met. To close your account, reach out via the same support link. Account closure is final and all associated records will be permanently deleted.
usecase_48: Membership in the 'Agri-Food Data Collaboration Platform' is contingent upon account creation. During this process, you must submit accurate, up-to-date, and complete information, and ensure it remains so. You are required to protect your password and are prohibited from disclosing it to any third party. If you notice any suspicious account activity, notify the support team immediately at: https://www.agrifooddata.org/help. You are solely accountable for all operations under your account. The platform reserves the right to deactivate your account for any breach of these guidelines, detection of fraudulent activity, or non-compliance with relevant laws. For account deletion, contact support at the provided link. Once deleted, all account data and content will be permanently erased.
usecase_49: To utilize the 'Urban Mobility Insights Platform', users must establish an account. When setting up your account, you are obligated to enter precise and current information, updating it as needed. You are solely responsible for maintaining the secrecy of your password and must not reveal it to anyone else. If you suspect your account has been compromised, report it immediately at: https://www.mobilityinsights.com/report. You bear full responsibility for all actions taken via your account. The platform retains the authority to suspend your account if you violate these terms, if any malicious or infringing activity is identified, or if legal standards are breached. To request account deletion, use the same reporting link. Account deletion is irreversible and all associated information will be permanently lost.
usecase_50: Participation in the 'Federated Manufacturing Data Space' necessitates account registration. During registration, you are required to provide valid, complete, and up-to-date information and keep it accurate. You must keep your password confidential and are forbidden from sharing it with third parties. If you become aware of any unauthorized access, you must notify the administration immediately at: https://www.fedmfgdata.com/contact. You accept sole responsibility for all actions performed under your account. The administrators reserve the right to disable your account for violations of these terms, detection of prohibited activities, or breaches of applicable law. To delete your account, contact administration via the same link. Deletion is permanent and all associated data will be irretrievably removed.
usecase_51: Accredited academic researchers may retrieve 'Historical Weather Sensor Data' from the Gaia-X Trusted Zone for environmental modeling, with access to the raw datasets limited to 48 hours. During utilization, they are required to acknowledge Gaia-X as the data provider in all published analyses and must not share the original datasets externally. For private meteorological firms wishing to embed the data into commercial forecasting tools, access is available upon payment of a per-terabyte licensing fee.
usecase_52: Certified logistics partners are authorized to download 'Cross-Border Freight Movement Records' from the Catena-X Network for supply chain risk assessment, but access to the detailed records is valid only for 96 hours. While analyzing the data, they must cite Catena-X as the source in all internal reports and are expressly forbidden from distributing the raw records to external parties. Commercial analytics vendors seeking to incorporate the data into proprietary dashboards may do so by paying a per-record access charge.
usecase_53: Verified healthcare providers are permitted to access 'Anonymized Clinical Trial Results' from the European Health Data Space for medical research, with raw data availability restricted to a 7-day window. When using the results, providers are obligated to reference the European Health Data Space in all research documentation and are strictly barred from transmitting the original datasets to third parties. Pharmaceutical companies aiming to integrate the data into drug development platforms may obtain access by paying a per-study licensing fee.
usecase_54: Authorized municipal planners may obtain 'Aggregated Traffic Flow Data' from the Urban Data Platform for infrastructure planning, with access to the unprocessed files expiring after 120 hours. During use, planners must attribute the Urban Data Platform in all planning documents and are strictly prohibited from sharing the original files with other organizations. Technology vendors wishing to embed the data into smart city applications can gain access by paying a per-gigabyte usage fee.
usecase_55: Recognized energy sector analysts are allowed to download 'Renewable Generation Profiles' from the Energy Data Exchange for grid optimization studies, with access to the raw profiles limited to 5 days. While utilizing the profiles, analysts are required to credit the Energy Data Exchange in all published findings and are strictly forbidden from redistributing the original profiles to outside entities. For energy solution providers seeking to integrate the data into proprietary optimization tools, access is available upon payment of a per-site data access fee.
usecase_56: Within the 'Gaia-X Trusted Zone', access to 'European Retail Footfall Sensors' is differentiated by a retailer's consent to demographic pattern analysis: consenting retailers receive prioritized, real-time sensor data, while those declining are given access to aggregated, anonymized datasets. Irrespective of consent, the system is categorically forbidden from generating or retaining any individual movement profiles from these data streams.
usecase_57: In the 'HealthDataSpace Consortium', access to 'Hospital Visitor Entry Logs' is allocated based on hospital administrators’ approval for behavioral analytics. Administrators who approve receive immediate, detailed logs; those who do not are provided with delayed, de-identified summaries. Regardless of approval status, the creation or storage of any personal identification profiles from these logs is strictly disallowed for all parties.
usecase_58: The 'Smart Port Data Exchange' grants shipping operators access to 'Dockside Surveillance Streams' contingent on their agreement to vessel recognition processing. Operators consenting to this processing gain prioritized, live video feeds; those opting out receive feeds with vessel identifiers obscured. Under all circumstances, the system is expressly barred from compiling or saving any biometric or vessel-specific identity profiles from the footage.
usecase_59: At the 'Urban Energy Data Space', utility providers’ access to 'Home Energy Consumption Cameras' depends on their willingness to enable appliance detection analytics. Providers who opt in receive real-time, detailed camera data, while those who opt out are given access to anonymized, event-based extracts. Regardless of provider choice, the platform is absolutely prohibited from constructing or storing any resident biometric or behavioral profiles from the captured data.
usecase_60: In the 'AgriTech Data Commons', access to 'Livestock Monitoring Feeds' is determined by a farm’s consent to animal health pattern analysis. Farms that consent receive prioritized, real-time video streams; those that do not are granted access to anonymized, batch-processed footage. Irrespective of the farm’s decision, the system is strictly forbidden from generating or storing any biometric or individual animal identification profiles from these feeds.
usecase_61: Within the Gaia-X Trusted Zone, the energy analytics firm PowerInsights is required to pay a per-query access fee to utilize GridNet's smart meter dataset, GN-Energy-Usage. Its derived metric, PeakLoadScore, can only be accessed through the platform’s approved API, and any bulk export or onward sharing is expressly forbidden. All subscription income from this metric is automatically split after each transaction by a smart contract: GridNet receives 40% as a data royalty, while PowerInsights keeps 60%. Each revenue split is immutably recorded on-chain for audit purposes.
usecase_62: In the HealthDataSpace, the clinical research platform MedStat Solutions must pay a per-request fee to access BioVault's anonymized patient cohort data, BV-Clinical-Trials. Its resulting analytics product, TrialSuccessRate, is permitted to be queried solely via the platform's validated API, with any batch extraction or external redistribution strictly disallowed. Subscription proceeds from this analytics service are automatically allocated after every transaction by a smart contract: BioVault earns 30% as a data royalty, and MedStat Solutions retains 70%. All distribution events are transparently recorded on the blockchain for compliance.
usecase_63: The Catena-X Automotive Network obliges the supplier analytics provider TierMetrics to pay a per-access fee for use of AutoDataHub’s supplier performance dataset, ADH-Supplier-Scorecards. Its processed output, SupplyRiskIndex, may only be accessed through the network’s certified API, with any mass download or third-party sharing strictly forbidden. Subscription revenues from this output are automatically distributed post-transaction via smart contract: AutoDataHub receives 25% as a data royalty, and TierMetrics keeps 75%. Each distribution is permanently logged on-chain as evidence.
usecase_64: Within the AgriData Commons, the agricultural insights firm CropVision must pay a per-API-call fee to access FarmNet’s satellite imagery dataset, FN-Field-Imagery. Its derivative product, YieldForecast, is only accessible through the Commons’ authorized API, with all forms of batch export or redistribution categorically prohibited. Subscription revenue from YieldForecast is automatically apportioned after each transaction by a smart contract: FarmNet receives 50% as a data royalty, and CropVision retains 50%. The revenue allocation is recorded on-chain for traceability.
usecase_65: In the Smart City Data Exchange, the urban planning analytics provider UrbanSense is required to pay a per-query fee for access to CityInfra’s sensor data set, CI-Traffic-Sensors. Its generated index, CongestionHeatmap, may exclusively be queried via the Exchange’s certified API, with any bulk download or onward redistribution strictly barred. All subscription earnings from this index are automatically divided after each transaction by a smart contract: CityInfra obtains 45% as a data royalty, while UrbanSense keeps 55%. Each transaction and revenue split is logged on-chain for transparency.
usecase_66: Before accessing the MedDataSpace's Clinical Imaging Archive, BioInsight Analytics must provide a national health data compliance clearance. Prior to any data transfer, the images must be re-anonymized within MedDataSpace's Secure Processing Hub. Usage is strictly limited to algorithm validation inside an accredited Secure Analysis Facility (SAF), and raw images are prohibited from leaving the SAF; only validated algorithm outputs devoid of original data may be exported. Access is restricted to analysts jointly vetted and enrolled by both organizations, with all user actions being streamed live to MedDataSpace's audit system.
usecase_67: To utilize the Gaia-X Trusted Zone's Aggregated Energy Consumption Dataset, GreenGrid Solutions is required to submit a domestic regulatory compliance statement. All data must be subject to an additional de-identification process within Gaia-X's Confidential Computing Node before any export. The dataset may be processed solely for demand forecasting inside a certified Confidential Analytics Environment (CAE), and unprocessed data is strictly barred from leaving the CAE; only forecast models free of source records may be shared externally. Only data scientists jointly authorized and listed by both entities may gain access, and their operational logs must be sent in real-time to Gaia-X's oversight module.
usecase_68: Prior to accessing the PharmaNet Data Space's Clinical Trial Results, HealthAI Consortium must first present a cross-jurisdictional data ethics approval from its regulatory body. All results must undergo further pseudonymization within PharmaNet's Secure Data Enclave before export. Use is permitted only for federated machine learning inside a pre-approved Federated Learning Node (FLN), and direct export of raw results is strictly prohibited; only aggregated model parameters without trial data may be transmitted. Access is limited to researchers jointly screened and registered by both parties, with all usage logs continuously relayed to PharmaNet's compliance monitor.
usecase_69: Access to the Smart City Data Hub's Environmental Sensor Streams requires UrbanSense Labs to first provide a municipal data governance attestation. All sensor data must be re-anonymized within the Data Hub's Trusted Processing Module before any transfer. The data may be used exclusively for urban air quality modeling within a designated Secure Modeling Workspace (SMW), and export of raw sensor streams is strictly forbidden; only processed model outputs free from original measurements may be exported. Only engineers jointly approved and enrolled by both organizations may access the data, and their activity records must be transmitted in real-time to the Data Hub's monitoring service.
usecase_70: To obtain the Catena-X Network's Supply Chain Traceability Dataset, TierOne Components must submit a national supply chain compliance certificate. All data must be subjected to secondary anonymization within Catena-X's Secure Computation Facility before export. The dataset is authorized solely for risk analysis within a certified Secure Analytics Environment (SAE), and raw traceability data is strictly not allowed to exit the SAE; only risk assessment reports that do not include source data may be exported. Access is granted only to analysts jointly reviewed and registered by both parties, and all user activity logs must be streamed in real-time to Catena-X's auditing node.
usecase_71: Within the 'Gaia-X Trusted Zone', any registered data contributor who identifies an integrity anomaly in shared 'Energy Consumption Logs' must notify the consortium within 10 minutes. The platform will immediately mark the dataset as 'Pending Audit' and halt all downstream API accesses. The original data owner is obligated to provide a detailed incident report within 4 hours and implement a validated correction, which must pass automated integrity checks, within 18 hours, or their ability to publish new data will be revoked. Should the same contributor encounter more than four such events in a 60-day span, they will be escalated to a compliance monitoring list. Once resolved, the system will dispatch an update alert to all consumers who accessed the logs in the preceding 36 hours.
usecase_72: In the 'Healthcare Research Data Space', any authorized research institution that detects a discrepancy in 'Clinical Trial Results' is required to log the issue within 20 minutes. The system will tag the affected dataset as 'Quality Check Pending' and suspend all data exports. The data steward must deliver a root-cause analysis within 8 hours and apply a fix, verified by automated quality assurance, within 30 hours, or face a temporary suspension of their data sharing privileges. If more than two such incidents are attributed to the same institution within a 120-day period, they will be subject to enhanced oversight. After resolution, a correction notification will be sent automatically to all parties who accessed the data during the last 72 hours.
usecase_73: Within the 'Smart Agriculture Data Exchange', any platform member who uncovers an error in 'Satellite Crop Imaging Data' shall report it within 12 minutes. The exchange will instantly classify the data as 'Under Investigation' and block further data queries. The data provider must submit a comprehensive incident explanation within 5 hours and complete a correction, which must pass automated validation, within 20 hours, or else their publishing capabilities will be suspended. If the provider records more than five such incidents in a 180-day window, they will be flagged for intensive review. Upon resolution, a system-generated update will inform all users who accessed the imaging data in the previous 60 hours.
usecase_74: In the 'Financial Services Data Space', any accredited participant who identifies a data accuracy problem in 'Real-Time Transaction Feeds' is obligated to report it within 5 minutes. The system will label the feed as 'Temporarily Restricted' and cease all API deliveries. The data originator must provide a root-cause report within 2 hours and resolve the issue, subject to automated verification, within 12 hours, or their data publishing rights will be revoked. If the same originator has more than six such cases within a 30-day period, they will be placed under special compliance review. Once the issue is fixed, the system will notify all clients who retrieved the feed in the last 24 hours.
usecase_75: Within the 'Supply Chain Transparency Network', any certified logistics partner who detects a reliability issue in 'Shipment Tracking Data' must file a report within 8 minutes. The network will mark the dataset as 'Review Required' and suspend all data synchronizations. The responsible data provider is required to submit a root-cause analysis within 3 hours and implement a correction, which must pass automated checks, within 16 hours, or risk suspension of their data publishing access. Should more than three such incidents occur for the same provider within a 45-day timeframe, they will be added to a heightened monitoring list. After the problem is resolved, the system will automatically alert all partners who accessed the data in the preceding 40 hours.
usecase_76: Prior to utilizing energy consumption datasets for machine learning model development, utility companies are required to submit a 'model transparency assessment' and verify that the model's fairness deviation score is below 0.05 before launch. The finalized model must undergo impartial bias and resilience testing in a certified Gaia-X Trusted Zone sandbox. Upon successful completion, a summary of results, intended application, and data provenance must be disclosed on the sectoral data portal. Following deployment, the data space steward reserves the authority to continuously monitor for bias, and if adverse societal impacts are detected, the operational license may be rescinded.
usecase_77: Before leveraging aggregated patient cohort data for predictive analytics, pharmaceutical consortia must provide an 'algorithmic risk disclosure' and demonstrate that the pre-deployment fairness metric does not exceed 0.05. The resultant model is obligated to undergo independent bias and robustness validation within a regulated health data sandbox. Once validated, the evaluation report, intended use, and data sources must be published on the clinical research registry. Post-deployment, the data space administrator maintains the right to perform ongoing bias assessments, and if detrimental effects on patient welfare are identified, the model's approval can be withdrawn.
usecase_78: Prior to employing supply chain traceability data for federated AI training, Tier-1 suppliers are mandated to submit a 'systemic impact analysis' and confirm that the model's fairness index remains under 0.05 ahead of rollout. The trained AI must be subjected to unbiased bias and robustness testing in the Catena-X Network sandbox. After passing, the assessment summary, project intent, and utilized datasets must be made available on the consortium’s transparency portal. After deployment, the network operator is entitled to conduct continuous bias surveillance, with the authority to revoke deployment rights if public trust is compromised.
usecase_79: Before using smart grid sensor data to develop demand forecasting models, energy cooperatives must file an 'AI ethics compliance report' and ensure the model's fairness score is below 0.05 prior to production. The completed model must be evaluated for bias and robustness in an independent Gaia-X sandbox environment. Upon passing, the evaluation summary, design rationale, and data usage log must be posted on the open energy data platform. After deployment, the cooperative retains the prerogative to monitor for persistent bias, and may suspend the model's operation if it is found to negatively impact grid stability or consumer rights.
usecase_80: Prior to processing cross-border logistics data for real-time shipment optimization, logistics platform operators must submit a 'model accountability statement' and verify that the model's fairness index is less than 0.05 before go-live. The trained system must undergo neutral third-party testing for bias and robustness in the International Data Spaces sandbox. Once approved, the evaluation synopsis, operational objective, and data lineage must be published on the global logistics data hub. Following deployment, the platform authority reserves the right to perform ongoing bias monitoring, with the power to revoke deployment if the model is shown to harm fair market access.
usecase_81: The 'Urban Air Quality Index 2023' dataset, curated by the SmartCity Environmental Alliance, is distributed under an 'Attribution-ShareAlike' (CC BY-SA) license. All participants in the Gaia-X Trusted Zone are permitted to adapt and generate derivative datasets, provided they clearly credit the original dataset using its DOI in both their analytical publications and the metadata of any new data products. Any resulting derivatives must be shared under a license equivalent to CC BY-SA. Academic institutions may access the dataset at no cost, whereas private sector organizations are required to pay a usage fee.
usecase_82: Within the AgriData Commons, the 'Crop Yield Satellite Imagery 2022' dataset, maintained by GreenFields Research, is governed by a CC BY-SA-style license. Members may transform and build upon the dataset, on the condition that they visibly acknowledge GreenFields Research and reference the dataset's DOI in all dissemination materials and derivative metadata. All new datasets derived from this source must be distributed under the same open license terms. Free access is provided to non-profit agricultural researchers, while agribusinesses must remit a data service charge.
usecase_83: The 'Renewable Energy Production Logs 2021', released by the European Energy Data Exchange, are made available under an Attribution-ShareAlike (CC BY-SA) license. Any Gaia-X Energy Data Space participant may alter and develop derivative works from the logs, so long as the original source is credited via its DOI in both usage documentation and derivative metadata. All derivative energy datasets must be published under a comparable CC BY-SA license. Academic researchers are exempt from access fees, but energy sector companies must pay a licensing fee for use.
usecase_84: In the HealthData Trust Framework, the 'Clinical Trial Outcomes 2020' dataset, provided by MedInsight Consortium, is licensed under a CC BY-SA equivalent. All authorized users may revise and generate derivative datasets, contingent upon explicit attribution of MedInsight Consortium and inclusion of the dataset's DOI in all reports and derivative metadata. Any new data products must be released under the same license conditions. University-affiliated researchers receive complimentary access, while pharmaceutical firms are subject to a data access fee.
usecase_85: The 'Smart Grid Consumption Patterns 2025' dataset, managed by the Digital Energy Alliance, follows an Attribution-ShareAlike (CC BY-SA) licensing model. All Data Space participants may edit and produce derivative datasets, provided they give clear credit to the Digital Energy Alliance and cite the dataset's DOI in both their usage summaries and derivative metadata. All derivatives must be made available under an equivalent CC BY-SA license. Public sector entities are granted free access, whereas commercial energy providers must pay a standard operational fee for dataset usage.
usecase_86: Within the Gaia-X Health Data Space, the 'NeuroScan Clinical Images' dataset, provided by a European hospital alliance, is subject to strict 'Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives' (CC BY-NC-ND) licensing. The dataset may only be accessed for academic research, with all alterations strictly forbidden. Academic institutions are required to secure ethics board approval before use and must credit the data provider in all scholarly outputs. Biotech firms requesting access must enter into a supplementary contract that bans the use of the dataset for machine learning development and obliges payment of a support fee at double the regular rate.
usecase_87: In the Trusted Medical Data Exchange, the 'OncoTrial Imaging Repository', curated by a national cancer research network, is regulated under the 'Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives' (CC BY-NC-ND) framework. Access is granted solely for non-profit investigative purposes, and any data transformation is expressly disallowed. University researchers must obtain institutional review board clearance prior to utilization and are mandated to cite the repository in all publications. Diagnostics companies seeking entry must sign an addendum forbidding AI training with the data and agree to a maintenance charge at twice the baseline amount.
usecase_88: The 'Federated Research Imaging Vault' within the MedDataNet ecosystem, managed by a coalition of teaching hospitals, enforces 'Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives' (CC BY-NC-ND) restrictions. The data is licensed exclusively for scholarly research, with no modifications permitted. Investigators must receive approval from a data governance committee before accessing the dataset and are obligated to acknowledge the source in any published findings. Medical device manufacturers applying for dataset access must execute an additional agreement that prohibits AI model development and requires payment of a service fee at double the usual rate.
usecase_89: Under the Swiss Health Data Trust, the 'RarePath Radiology Set', contributed by a consortium of university clinics, is governed by 'Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives' (CC BY-NC-ND) terms. The dataset is authorized solely for non-commercial scientific analysis, with modification strictly barred. Research teams must secure prior ethics committee endorsement and must reference the data origin in all dissemination. Digital health startups requesting access must sign a supplemental contract disallowing use for AI algorithm training and must pay a stewardship fee at twice the standard level.
usecase_90: In the Nordic Medical Imaging Exchange, the 'Pediatric NeuroImaging Collection', assembled by a regional hospital partnership, is controlled by 'Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives' (CC BY-NC-ND) licensing. The dataset is permitted for non-commercial academic study only, and any edits or adaptations are forbidden. Scholars must obtain ethics panel approval before use and are required to attribute the dataset in all resulting academic work. Health analytics vendors applying for access must sign a supplementary agreement that bans AI training on the data and mandates a maintenance payment at twice the ordinary rate.
usecase_91: The 'Urban Energy Grid Data Set 2024', provided by the National Energy Board, is licensed under 'ShareAlike' (CC BY-SA 4.0), granting broad rights for use and redistribution. Recipients are required to fulfill two ongoing obligations: a semi-annual report on data-driven efficiency improvements must be submitted; and if a premium analytics platform is built using this dataset, 2% of its yearly profits must be allocated to the National Renewable Data Fund. Should a system outage last more than three hours, all active platform operators must submit detailed incident response logs.
usecase_92: The 'Smart Agriculture Sensor Feed 2023', curated by the AgriTech Consortium, is distributed under 'Open Data Commons Attribution License', allowing unrestricted usage and sharing. Stakeholders must comply with two obligations: a biannual summary of application outcomes must be provided; and if the data enables a paid subscription service, 1.5% of annual gross income must be paid into the AgriData Sustainability Trust. If a data delivery interruption surpasses 90 minutes, all current service users are required to file disruption impact statements.
usecase_93: The 'Maritime Logistics Events Stream', made available by the Port Authority Alliance, is governed by the 'Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International' license, supporting extensive use and redistribution. All users must observe two obligations: submit a usage impact assessment every six months; and if a monetized logistics solution is developed, 1% of its yearly turnover must be contributed to the Maritime Data Infrastructure Fund. In case of a service downtime exceeding one hour, all active solution providers are obligated to report incident details.
usecase_94: The 'Healthcare Facility Occupancy Dataset', released by the National Health Data Space, is licensed under 'Attribution-NoDerivatives' (CC BY-ND 4.0), enabling broad use and redistribution. Users are bound by two obligations: an annual report on operational improvements achieved with the data must be submitted; and if a commercial patient flow management tool is created, 0.5% of its yearly revenue must be donated to the Health Data Commons. If a data access interruption lasts longer than two hours, all current tool operators must submit incident impact documentation.
usecase_95: The 'Renewable Energy Production Metrics 2024', published by the Green Energy Exchange, is licensed under 'Attribution-ShareAlike' (CC BY-SA 4.0), authorizing wide-ranging use and redistribution. All participants must meet two obligations: a quarterly effectiveness report on renewable integration must be filed; and if a commercial dashboard is built using this data, 1% of its annual sales must be contributed to the Renewable Data Stewardship Fund. Should a service outage persist for over two hours, all active dashboard users are required to submit incident impact records.
usecase_96: The 'Open Science Data Repository', curated by the National Research Data Trust, operates under a 'CC BY-NC-SA' framework. Academic institutions are permitted to adapt and remix datasets for non-commercial research, provided that all resulting datasets are shared under the same license. When publishing a derived dataset, researchers must record its checksum on the designated research data blockchain and cite the original dataset's DOI in the metadata. Any use of the data or derivatives in commercial consulting or for-profit projects requires the purchase of an annual commercial license.
usecase_97: Within the 'Digital Artifacts Exchange', managed by the Global Museum Consortium, a 'CC BY-NC-SA' policy governs the use of digitized artifact images. Non-profit organizations may modify and combine these images for educational purposes, but all new works must be distributed under the same license. Upon release of a derivative, contributors are obligated to register its hash on the museum's provenance blockchain and include the source artifact's accession number in the credits. Commercial publication or reproduction in paid exhibitions necessitates a separate annual commercial license.
usecase_98: The 'AgriData Commons', maintained by the Sustainable Farming Alliance, applies a 'CC BY-NC-SA' license to its collection of crop yield datasets. Agricultural researchers are authorized to analyze and remix these datasets for non-commercial innovation, with the stipulation that any derivative datasets be licensed identically. When sharing a new dataset, users must submit its hash to the alliance's data integrity blockchain and reference the original dataset's catalog ID in the documentation. Commercial deployment in agri-tech platforms or paid analytics services requires an annually renewed commercial license.
usecase_99: In the 'Urban Planning Knowledge Hub', overseen by the Smart Cities Council, urban design blueprints are shared under a 'CC BY-NC-SA' license. City planners may adapt and merge these blueprints for non-commercial municipal projects, but must release any resulting plans under the same license terms. Upon publication, the planner is required to log the blueprint's hash to the council's urban data blockchain and display the original plan's reference code in the project summary. Any commercial application in real estate development or consultancy mandates the acquisition of an annual commercial license.
usecase_100: The 'Medical Imaging Data Space', facilitated by the European Health Data Network, enforces a 'CC BY-NC-SA' license on its anonymized MRI scan library. Healthcare researchers are permitted to process and combine these scans for non-commercial clinical studies, with the condition that all derivatives maintain the same license. When a derivative dataset is published, its hash must be recorded on the health data blockchain and the original scan's unique identifier must be cited in the study. Commercial use in medical device development or paid diagnostic services is only allowed with an annually purchased commercial license.
